Job Description Job Overview: Ensure that all work carried out safely in compliance with HS&E policies and procedures. Prepare Installation Procedure(s) in accordance with the Level II Procedure and with due regard for safety. The scope of procedures required will be defined by the Operations Engineer. Recommend changes in the technical details, drawings, where these may result in safer and better installation procedures. Develop (or review those provided by others) loadout and sea fastening plans for the transportation of materials / structures to the offshore site that facilitate safe and timely installation. Liase with Project Manager, General Superintendent, Barge Superintendent, Diving Manager, Safety Manager E& M Manager, Marine Base Superintendent, Purchasing Personnel, Offshore Service Subcontractors Responsibilities Key Tasks and Responsibilities: • Actively participate in project Job Safety Analysis, if applicable, and communicate and implement these. • Review and retain project drawings and documents, report to the Project Manager discrepancies, errors and omission with respect to the information required to perform the work. • Ensure the work is within the capabilities of the proposed equipment. • Maintain project files in the office and in the field in accordance with project requirements. • Prepare Installation Procedure(s) in accordance with the Level II Procedure and with due regard for safety. The scope of procedures required will be defined by the Operations Engineer. As a minimum, the procedure(s) will outline the following: • Methods, techniques and practices to be used to perform to work. • The sequence(s) to be used to perform the work. • Installation aids, temporary works and consumables required to perform the work. • Prepare material lists for construction materials and project consumables and liaise with the Project Coordinator for procurement of requirements. • Issue 'Loadout Lists' applicable to the work in accordance with the recommended practice. • Coordinate with Marine, E & M and Diving departments to ensure that necessary equipment and personnel are available and readied for the project. • Witness / inspect pre-rigging, loadouts, sea fastening and acknowledge the receipt of fabricated structures, line pipe and other materials to be installed offshore. Developing checklists and inspecting loadouts in accordance with Level II Procedures. • Coordinate with the Production Engineers and verify loadouts of fabricated items required for the project. • Liaise with the customer representative and various subcontractor representatives at the offshore site and with the Operation Engineer. • Ensure the contract / project related documentation is maintained and I or transmitted to the Customer at the site: • Review Daily Progress Reports. • Force Account Sheets and / or Change Order Notification in accordance with contract specifications. • As-built documentation (sketches, records, videos) in accordance with approved procedures. • Monitor the progress of the work and site conditions and advise the Operations Engineer of any development that may result in changes to the project schedule and / or execution. • Advise the Barge Superintendent and I or Barge staff including Subcontractors (such as Surveyor, ROV, NOT, Pile Monitoring personnel) regarding the planning and execution of the work and the contractual and technical aspects • of the work. Issuing field sketches, data sheets and checklists in the field where required for information purposes for the Barge staff. • Participate in the resolution of any technical problems arising during offshore installation and assist in the formulation of corrective action requirement. • Plan and supervise the execution of pipeline pigging and testing operations in accordance with approved project procedures. Responsibilities will include: • Assist with procurement of all consumables. • Marshalling of all equipment. • Pigging and testing calculations and procedure preparation. • Supervise and document all operations and operating instrumentation. • Complete pigging and testing reports. • Prepare Post-Job Reports in accordance with the Level II Procedures. • Prepare / collate as-built documentation and, records in accordance with the contract requirements and the approved project indices. Qualifications Essential Qualifications and Education: • 1-2 Years in Offshore industry • Degree in relevant engineering discipline. • Working knowledge of design and offshore project execution Company Overview and Core Values: McDermott is a premier, fully-integrated provider of technology, engineering and construction solutions to the energy industry. For more than a century, customers have trusted McDermott to design and build end-to-end infrastructure and technology solutions—from the wellhead to the storage tank—to transport and transform oil and gas into the products the world needs today. At McDermott, we hold all employees accountable to follow our 5 core values. • Integrity – we maintain a firm adherence to legal and ethical conduct • One Team – we are one company, where everyone is equally important • Go Beyond – we seek courageous and creative solutions • Well-Being – we promote all forms of well-being • Commitment – we are reliable and dependable in delivering quality solutions

NEPTUNE ENERGY IS AN INDEPENDENT ENERGY COMPANY WITH OPERATIONS IN EUROPE, NORTH AFRICA AND ASIA PACIFIC. Neptune Energy is uniquely positioned for the energy transition. We aim to go beyond net zero by storing more carbon than we, and our customers, emit by 2030. Our vision is to be the leading E&P company by meeting society’s changing energy needs and creating value for our stakeholders. We provide secure supplies of energy with a differentiated portfolio that is gas-weighted, long life, low cost and lower carbon. Established in 2018, we now employ some 1,300 people in the UK, Norway, Netherlands, Germany, Algeria, Egypt, Indonesia and Australia. Our values of excellence in health, safety and the environment, accountability, integrity and teamwork are a core component of our business and help guide our actions. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We encourage applications from qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, colour, national or ethnic origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the countries where we operate. Neptune Energy holds participating interest in multiple PSC’s in the Kutai Basin deepwater area offshore East Kalimantan, Indonesia; namely Muara Bakau, East Sepinggan, West Ganal, East Ganal and North Ganal PSC. As a non-operating party, Neptune adopts a proactive approach by actively engaging with Operator to identify optimization and efficiency improvement opportunities in all areas of involvement, including project execution. Values Neptune has a set of fundamental values that guide our people and the way we grow our business sustainably: Excellence in HSEQ, Integrity, Individual Accountability and Teamwork. Our Group structure is designed to support these values – it centralises responsibilities and distributes decision-making. With these values at the heart of how we operate, we deliver growth by: Running our assets and driving our production in a safe, sustainable and efficient manner; Developing our exploration projects to ensure healthy reserves replacement; Integrating past acquisitions successfully and high-grading our portfolio of activities; Considering additional M&A activities if these are value-accretive; Driving an entrepreneurial culture without compromising integrity or safety in anything we do. Culture Neptune Energy’s culture is centred around HSEQ, entrepreneurship, efficiency and value, attracting top E&P industry talent and creating an environment where our employees can flourish. HSEQ is valued above all else and we are strongly committed to achieving best-in-class HSEQ standards, ensuring continued safe, reliable operations across all the whole organisation. The environment is a key consideration and Neptune Energy is committed to environmentally responsible operations, energy efficiency and transition to a low carbon future. For our Project & Engineering department, we are looking for a candidate to fulfill the position of LEAD FACILITIES ENGINEER, IN Location Jakarta Job description Responsible for Neptune Energy Indonesia’s project execution, including Merakes East, Maha and other brownfield project and engineering activities supporting Kutai Basin deepwater operation, operated by other Operator. May be requested to support other Neptune Energy global project portfolio. Reports to: Director of Global Project & Engineering, with strong collaboration with Project Manager, AU Main duties and responsibilities • The main duty of the Lead FACILITIES Engineer (Subsea Umbilical Riser Flowline) is technical scope of Merakes East and other brownfield modification projects in Muara Bakau and East Sepinggan PSC. Additionally, the role manages the day-to-day project activities and acting as the local Neptune project representative in front of Operator. Under the guidance of the leadership team, the role involves in progressing other projects portfolio, such as Maha development in West Ganal PSC and business development project. • We prioritize Health, Safety, Environment and Quality (HSEQ) as our way of doing thing. The role will ensure that the assurance and compliance of applicable codes, standards, and best practices; and ensuring corporate reporting, measurement and compliance process is satisfied. • To be successful, you will demonstrate an effective interface and integration management with internal (subsurface, finance, and other global functions) and external stakeholders (operator). Required qualifications and experience • Bachelor’s degree in engineering • Advanced degree in engineering, project or business desired but not necessary • Minimum of 12-year experience in engineering and project of the upstream energy industry project, preferably in offshore and/or deepwater with subsea development • Demonstrate team player behavior but also ability to work independently. • Prior working experience with Indonesia’s Production Sharing Contract (PSC) system, familiarity with SKK Migas WP&B, AFE, Plan of Development (POD) and Procurement/Contracting process • Practitioner in the Project Management application, including planning, budgeting, assurance process, project control services, reporting, risk management, and others • Track record of managing internal and external stakeholders, for example members of technical, management or operating committee in Joint Venture operations; managing external EPCI/ engineering firms on behalf of company or other similar experiences • Strong communication skill including fluency in Bahasa Indonesia and English. Comfortable in communicating with executives at business unit and enterprise level Behaviours In Neptune we are looking for team members who: • Act with humility, promote inclusivity and treat everyone with dignity and respect • Seek out ways to collaborate and promote a culture of shared learning and knowledge in order to maximise value • Seek opportunities for positive change and continuous improvement • Are not afraid to push boundaries and challenge conventional wisdom and established truths • Can adapt and act quickly in the face of changing situations • Understand and anticipate stakeholder needs and use this insight to shape actions and decisions appropriately • Hold themselves and others to account for their contribution and performance • Show an unwavering commitment to safety, and have high standards of personal integrity Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Neptune we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. What we offer: At Neptune we are committed to supporting everyone to learn, develop and gain new experiences. We have an open culture, so it is easy to make your voice heard and have a say in our future and your own development. The work we do is challenging, stimulating and complex; you will be empowered to play a direct part and will be able to see the impact of your role. We work in a highly collaborative way, so you will interface frequently with colleagues outside of your direct team, and at all levels of the organisation. Information and application We are looking forward to your application! Please be informed that an assessment and reference check can be part of the recruitment procedure.

Join us, and you can expect: • Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities • Comprehensive private medical care options • Safety net of life insurance and disability programs • Tailored financial programs • Additional elected or voluntary benefits About Us With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient. Join Us Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you! About Us: We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet. Join Us: Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! job_description: Consultancy – A/R Expert or Auditor Sumatera, Indonesia August – November 2023 WHO WE ARE PUR is a global leader in supply chain sustainability. We develop socio-environmental projects within the supply chains of our Corporate Partners. Through the economic and social empowerment of local communities and the introduction of sustainable development initiatives at the agricultural level, PUR seeks to address climate change, while regenerating and preserving the ecosystems upon which these supply chains depend. Many of PUR’s projects fall within the categories of insetting, regenerative agriculture, agroforestry, forest conservation and landscape restoration. PUR is a B Corp Company which employs over 180 people and a presence in 15 countries. www.pur.co PUR Projet is seeking a consultant or auditor to audit its A/R project in Indonesia The Kopi Lestari project is an agroforestry project launched in 2012 in Aceh, which has then been extended to North Sumatra and Lampung. With the help of three main local partners (coffee cooperatives and buyers), the project has planted more than 1.2 million trees with coffee producers. As part of PUR’s quality control framework, periodic audits which include a desk review and reality checks on-site (on farms) are conducted by third parties, following methodologies and protocols designed in-house by PUR. The consultant, under the supervision and guidance of the PUR team, will have the responsibility to carry out the following list of actions: • Socialisation: Introduction to the PUR’s project teams, Gathering project context information, Leading the audit opening meeting and Informing the local partners’ teams of the objectives and course of the audit process • Desk review: Assessing the project’s documents and KPIs against PUR Projet’s quality standard to identify good practices, errors and missing information • Local stakeholders’ consultation: Challenging the results of the desk review and interviewing the local partners, Calibration of the field check (i.e. list of parcels to be visited) • Field check: Preparing and Performing the field check; Reviewing and assessing results • Conclusion report: Sharing conclusions and corrective actions requests We are looking for a consultant/auditor with: • Engineer or Master’s Degree in Forestry, Agriculture, Natural Resources Management or equivalent expertise • Strong leadership and experience in team management and coordination of various stakeholders • Comfortable with both field and office work • Good oral and written presentation skills • Familiar with Sumatera (native from the area is a strong plus) • Proficient in the use of the Microsoft Office Suite, GIS and Google Drive • Knowledge and experience using Kobo Toolbox or ODK • Fluent in Bahasa Indonesia and English • Capable of building, training and managing a team of surveyors to support the field checks • Work permit in Indonesia, possibility to emit bills or invoices Mission modalities: • The methodology of the audit as well as the data collection tools will be provided by PUR. The Consultant is not expected to design the audit methodology nor an impact study framework. • The mission is expected to require 50 to 60 days of work from the consultant, incl. 20 days of field data collection. This does not include the man-days of the field surveyors. The sample of parcels to be visited is estimated between 500 and 1000 parcels. • Vehicles and devices for data collection are not provided. • The Consultant should send their proposal, including daily rates for their team, and per diem to cover transportation, food and accommodation during the field data collection period. How can you apply? Send your CV, Technical & Financial Proposal, and Business registration to lorena.frier@pur.co and arif.kurniawan@pur.co by 18/06/2023. The recruitment process will consist in 2 interviews. Please be prepared to have two references, and extra deliverables, if possible, available upon request.

PT Aneka Tambang (Persero) Tbk - Antam is one of the largest state-owned mining companies in Indonesia. The company was founded in 1968 as a result of a merger or amalgamation of several national mining companies that produce a single commodity. As a state-owned company, most of the company's shares are owned by the government of the Republic of Indonesia with a composition of 65% shares. The remaining 35% of the shares are owned by the public or the general public. The main commodities of this mining company are high-grade nickel ore (saprolite), low-grade nickel ore (limonite), ferronickel, gold, silver, and bauxite. The company also performs precious metal processing and refining activities as well as geological services as the main services The Role Your Responsibilities Will Include • Designing control systems to minimize costs and production issues • Developing design and production standards in cooperation with management and user personnel • Preparing material and equipment lists, purchase orders, cost analyses, and estimated production costs • Designing the layout of facilities and determine personnel requirements • Training staff for new processes and provide instructions and manuals Ideal Profile Skills Required • You have Proven work experience as an Industrial Engineer or a similar role • You have Advanced knowledge of production machinery, processes, and standards • You possess Critical thinking and problem-solving skills • You have Troubleshooting expertise and attention to detail • You possess a Degree in Industrial Engineering or a related field preferred What's on Offer? • Opportunity within a company with a solid track record of performance • Fantastic work culture • Flexible working options

job_title: Smelter Operation Readiness - Engineer Network and Radio Systems
job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Engineer Network and Radio Systems will be responsible for installing, monitoring, maintaining, configuring, upgrading, and supporting the organizations computer network with a focus on digital trunk two-way radios systems, including the infrastructure as well as the radio subscribers. This role will work closely with production, maintenance, and security teams, providing support and ensuring the successful operations of our network and two-way radio communication systems. This position will play a critical role in ensuring that the organizations two-way radio systems are designed, implemented, and maintained to meet business needs, while ensuring the security, reliability, performance, and regulatory compliance of the radio system and make important decisions to achieve these goals. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Work closely with operations, maintenance, and security departments to understand their needs. • Collaborate with other engineers to ensure seamless integration of the two-way radios systems with other systems and networks. • Configure and tune two-way infrastructure as well as program handheld and base station subscribers. • Maintain the two-way radio systems to continuously meet the companys business requirements. • Monitor the two-way radios systems performance, capacity, and usage, including developing and implementing testing procedures to ensure the systems meet performance and quality standards. • Troubleshoot and resolve issues with two-way radio systems as they arise. • Provide technical support and training to end users as required. • Configure and maintain network hardware and software, including routers, switches, wireless access devices, network controllers, and virtual appliances. • Monitor network and two-way performance and troubleshoot network issues to ensure uptime and performance targets of 99.95% are meet. • Planning and executing network infrastructure upgrades, such as upgrading hardware, software and security protocols and ensure these upgrades are implemented in a timely and efficient manner. • Develop and maintain network and two-way radio documentation, including network diagrams, inventory lists and maintenance schedules. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of network and radio related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. The key challenges in this position include: • Keeping up with Technology: Two-way radio and networking technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that you have the skills and knowledge necessary to provide effective support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Network Security: Ensuring two-way radio and network security is a critical task for engineers. As hackers become more sophisticated, protecting networks against cyber-attacks is becoming more challenging. You will need to stay up to date with the latest security threats and implement measures to prevent them. • Troubleshooting: Communication outages can be detrimental to safety as well as the business operations and profitability. You must be able to diagnose and troubleshoot issues quickly and effectively to minimize downtime. • Communication Skills: Need to have excellent communication skills to collaborate with other IT professionals, stakeholders, and end users. You must be able to explain complex technical issues in non-technical terms to ensure that everyone understands the problem and proposed solution. • Managing Customer Expectations: Customers may have high expectations with the resources and capabilities of the team. Effective communication and managing expectations can help mitigate these challenges. • Hazardous Environment: Smelting operations can be dangerous, you must be aware of and follow strict safety protocols when visiting and working in these environments, using specialized protective gear to ensure safety. • High Pressure Environment: Mining and smelting operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or related field. • 5+ Years of experience in implementing and supporting Motorola Digital Trunk Radio System. • Certification, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) is a plus. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong knowledge of business network infrastructure and design including two-way radio system, telephone systems, digital trunk radio, network protocols, fiber optic / ethernet cabling standards and AC/DC power systems. • Strong knowledge and understanding of radio frequencies and propagation technics. • Strong knowledge of Department of KOMINFO regulations surrounding the importation, licensing, and use of RF devices. • Strong knowledge of network protocols and technologies such as TCP/IP, routing protocols, VLANS, VPNs and QoS. • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. • Ability to troubleshoot issues and provide technical support. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in the metal processing industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. The key areas in which you have decision-making responsibility are: • Optimization of Radio System: Continuously work to optimize communication systems, ensuring that they are reliable, efficient, and meet the business needs. Optimize factors such as bandwidth, data rates, and signal strength/noise ratio to improve the overall performance of the system. • Documentation: Maintain detailed records of the design and testing of the communication systems. Preparing documents including specifications, user guides, test plans, system documentation. • Compliance: Ensure that the communication systems comply with government regulations and corporate standards, modifying systems and or applying for additional permits and license to ensure continuous compliance. • Collaborating: Working closely with other engineers, and stakeholders to ensure that the radio system meets the requirements of the operations. This may involve collaborating on design decisions, identifying, and resolving technical issues, and managing project timelines and budgets. • Selecting hardware and software components: Must choose the right hardware and software components for the radio system, based on factors such as performance, compatibility, scalability, security, and cost. Must evaluate and compare different options and make recommendations to management. • Troubleshooting two-way radio and network issues: When issues arise, must diagnose the problem, and find a solution quickly. Must make decisions to ensure that the network is up and running as soon as possible and minimize downtime and data loss. • Capacity planning: Must forecast the companys future two-way radio needs and make decisions about how to scale the radio system infrastructure to meet those needs. Must analyze traffic/call patterns, predict growth, and make recommendations for upgrades and expansions. Dimensions Financial • Approvals: Review end user requests for communication devices and peripherals and approving or rejecting these requests by determining business need and aligning with company policies and government regulations. • Repair or Replace: Making decisions as to if repairing or replacing a device would be the most cost-effective long term. • Cost Control: Will be responsible for controlling costs associated with network support, including identifying areas for cost savings. Non-Financial • Maintain: Manage the lifecycle of two-way radio infrastructure and subscriber assets comprising two distinct and separate radio systems, one for Smelter operations and the other for the Precious Metal Refinery (PMR). With a total of 1,00 radio users. • Customer Satisfaction: Meeting the needs of the organizations one thousand end users, spread across several geographic locations, including users working remotely and resolving technical issues in a timely and effective manner. Dateline: 27 may 2023

job_title: Smelter Operation Readiness - Superintendent Network, Wireless & Control Systems
job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Superintendent Network, Wireless and Control Systems will be responsible for managing a team of network support technicians overseeing and managing the technical operations and infrastructure of the various wired and wireless network systems, both for business administration and smelter process control. This role will work closely with production teams, other engineers, and management to identify and solve process control issues, and ensure that production processes are efficient, reliable and safe. This position will oversee the day-to-day operations of the team, ensuring that the team is able to maintain and troubleshoot network systems, monitor network performance, and respond to technical issues in a timely and effective manner. This supervisory position is to ensure that the network infrastructure is secure, stable, operates effectively and efficiently, with minimal downtime and disruptions, and meets the organizations requirements. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Managing network operations, overseeing the day-to-day operations of the companys business and process control networks across multiple sites. This includes ensuring that the network is functioning properly, troubleshooting any issues that arise, and making sure that all network systems are running smoothly. • Planning and implementing network infrastructure upgrades, such as upgrading hardware, software and security protocols and ensure these upgrades are implemented in a timely and efficient manner. • Managing network security, ensuring that the network is secure from unauthorized access or cyber-attacks. Must implement and manage security protocols, such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and access control policies. • Leading a team of network technicians who are responsible for maintaining and troubleshooting the network. Provide guidance, support, and training to the team to ensure that they can perform their duties effectively. • Monitoring network performance, to identify potential issues and address them before they become major problems. Ensure that the network is performing at optimal levels to meet the needs of the organization. • Develop and maintain network documentation, including network diagrams, inventory lists and maintenance schedules. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of network related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. • Collaborate with production teams, management, and other engineers to identify process control problems, analyze data, and propose solutions. • Participate in the development and implementation of IT projects related to network infrastructure. • Recruiting, training and mentor new and existing network technicians and evaluating the performance of support technicians. • Budgeting and resource management, of the network support team and ensure that resources are used effectively to support the organizations goals and objectives. The key challenges in this position include: • Managing a Team: One of the biggest challenges will be managing a team of network support technicians, including subordinates from various ethnicities, religions, and cultures, to maximize their full potential, this includes hiring, training, coaching and performance management. This can be challenging, especially when dealing with conflicts and differing highly technical opinions. • Data Security: The metals industry relies heavily on data to make informed decisions. As a network and wireless supervisor, you will need to ensure that the network is secure from unauthorized access and that sensitive data is protected from cyber threats. • Equipment Maintenance: Network systems requires frequent maintenance and repairs. As a network and wireless supervisor, you will need to coordinate with maintenance teams to ensure that equipment downtime is minimized, and network connectivity is restored as quickly as possible. • Meeting Service Level Agreements: Responsible for ensuring that your team meets the service level agreements set by the organization. This requires effective communication with other departments and stakeholder to ensure that service expectations are met. • Keeping up with Technological Advancements: The world of networking technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that the team is providing the best possible support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Prioritizing Tasks: This supervisory position will need to prioritize tasks and delegate responsibilities to ensure that all issues are addressed in a timely and efficient manner. You will on occasion need to prioritize urgent issues and handle conflicting demands from different stakeholders. • Resolving Complex and Technical Issues: This role will be responsible for handling complex technical issues that the team may not be able to resolve on their own. This requires a strong technical background and the ability to troubleshoot and solve problems quickly. • Managing Customer Expectations: Customers may have high expectations with the resources and capabilities of the team. Effective communication and managing expectations can help mitigate these challenges. • Hazardous Environment: Smelting operations can be dangerous, the network and wireless supervisor must be aware of and follow strict safety protocols when visiting and working in these environments, using specialized protective gear to ensure safety. • High Pressure Environment: Mining and smelting operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, and as a supervisor, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. • Ensuring Compliance with Regulations: There are numerous government regulations that govern the use and management of computer networks. As a supervisor, you need to ensure that your team is following the regulations and implementing appropriate security measures to protect the network and sensitive data. • Staff Retention: In remote locations, attracting and retaining skilled staff can be a challenge. This supervisory position must create an environment that fosters a positive workplace culture and provides opportunities for professional growth and development to retain staff. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field. • Certification, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) • 5+ Years of experience in network support and management at least 2 years in a supervisory role. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong knowledge of business network infrastructure and design including TCP/IP, IP telephone systems, digital trunk radio, network protocols, fiber optic / ethernet cabling standards and AC/DC power systems. • Strong knowledge and understanding of process control systems such as Distributed Control Systems (DCS) Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) and other data acquisition systems. • Experience managing and maintaining large-scale network infrastructure. • Knowledge of network security, data protection and disaster recovery. • Ability to troubleshoot network issues and provide technical support. • Experience in managing and mentoring a team of network support technicians. • Excellent communication and leadership skills. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in the metal processing industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. The key areas in which you have decision-making responsibility are: • Managing Staff: Making decision regarding staffing, training and performance management and the allocation of resource and delegation of tasks. • Resource Allocation: Required to make decisions about the allocation of resources, including personnel, equipment, and budget, for network maintenance, support, and expansion. • Performance Optimization: Monitoring network performance, identifying areas of weakness, and implementing strategies to optimize network performance. • Network Capacity & Maintenance: Making decisions related to network capacity and maintenance, such as scheduling downtime for upgrades or repairs, and ensuring that the network is operating at optimal levels. • Incident Management: Prioritizing incidents based on severity and impact, assigning incidents to support staff, and ensuring that incidents are resolved within agreed-upon service level agreements. • Procurement: Making decision regarding the procurement of hardware, software, and other equipment necessary for the smooth functioning of the network. • Vendor Management: Make decisions about the selection and management of external vendors that provide technical support services. This includes negotiating contracts, managing vendor relationships, and ensuring that vendors meet service level agreements. • Technology Upgrades: Make decisions about when and how to upgrade hardware and software. This includes assessing the impact of upgrades on end-users and control systems, developing upgrade plans, and coordinating the implementation of upgrades with other teams within the organization. • Evaluating New Technologies: Evaluate new technologies and tools that can improve the support services provided by the team. This includes evaluating new software applications, hardware and other technologies that can enhance the user experience. • Continuous Improvement: Continually evaluate the effectiveness of support service and make decision to improve processes, procedures, and training programs to enhance the quality of support provided. • Budgeting: Manage the budget allocated for the network and wireless team, ensuring that it is being used efficiently and effectively. This includes monitoring expenses and forecasting future needs to ensure that the team has the resources it needs to deliver high quality support services. Dimensions Financial • Budgeting: Will be responsible for developing and managing an annual operating budget of approximately US$ 2 MM. Managing the budget for the team, including allocating resources for hardware, software, and other technical needs. • Repair or Replace: Making decisions as to if repairing or replacing a device would be the most cost-effective long term. • Cost Control: Will be responsible for controlling costs associated with network support, including identifying areas for cost savings, and negotiating vendor support contracts. • ROI Analysis: Required to perform return of investment (ROI) analysis to determine the financial impact or support initiatives or projects as well as make decisions on repair vs. replace. Non-Financial • Maintain: The supervisor must manage the lifecycle of network infrastructure assets comprising hundreds of network routers, switches, wireless access points, telephones, digital trunk radio systems, fiber and ethernet cabling systems. • Leadership: The supervisor is responsible for leading the team and ensuring that they are working effectively and efficiently. This includes setting expectations, providing guidance, and motivating team members. • Customer Satisfaction: The supervisor must ensure that their team is meeting the needs of the organizations one thousand end users, spread across several geographic locations, including users working remotely and resolving technical issues in a timely and effective manner. • Performance Management: The supervisor will be responsible for evaluating the performance of their six direct reports, providing feedback, and identifying areas for improvement. • Process Improvement: The supervisor should be able to identify opportunities for process improvement and develop strategies for implementing changes that will increase efficiency and effectiveness. Dateline: 27 Mei 2023

job_title: Senior Analyst Climate and Energy, Indonesia
job_description: Join Ember's fast-growing, global team as Indonesia embarks on its journey towards its net-zero target. This role is essential in supporting Ember’s work on establishing an understanding of methane emissions from coal mining in Indonesia and the opportunities for reducing these to support Indonesia’s commitments under the Global Methane Pledge. We’re committed to providing a great place to work at a competitive salary. We invest in our staff, offer flexible working conditions and pride ourselves on being an open and collaborative workplace. We’re a friendly and supportive team, and all passionately committed to addressing the climate crisis. A significant barrier to Indonesia’s transition to clean power is high dependence on fossil fuels for electricity generation, wherein coal is the highest contributor. This means that the coal industry plays a critical role in both the energy and climate challenge. Coal mining is the largest source of methane emissions in Indonesia, but these emissions remain unmonitored. Methane is the 2nd biggest contributor to global warming with shorter atmospheric lifetime but stronger potency and warming potential. This Coal Mine Methane (CMM) is set to grow significantly, unless, of course, intervened. As highlighted by the IPCC and IEA, addressing Coal Mine Methane is also one of the most cost-effective emissions reduction strategies in the short term. Ember has already made a major international impact in drawing attention to the methane crisis in Australia and the European Union. Please read more about our work here: https://ember-climate.org/topics/coal-mine-methane Ember sees an opportunity in Indonesia to utilize our approach to critical data analysis to evaluate the impact of coal mine methane and reduce the climate impact of the coal sector. Indonesia is increasing coal production, but we see significant opportunity to make progress in Indonesia, as a signatory to the Global Methane Pledge. There is a crucial window to shine the light on the issue and the opportunities to abate these emissions, especially as technology already exists to do so. Ember is looking for a passionate Senior Analyst to lead Ember's Coal Mine Methane (CMM) activities in Indonesia, with support from our existing CMM team based in Europe, Australia and India. To apply you do not need specific expertise in mining or coal mine methane, but a broad understanding of the climate and energy landscape and an appetite to work with many different stakeholders. The successful candidate will have: • Adequate capacity to research and source national data on methane emissions to support our efforts to reduce emissions in Indonesia • A deep understanding of climate and energy topics • A good sense of the related developments in the country • A strong network in government and may also have relationships with international and Indonesian NGOs Location This is a remote post, but you would need to be based in Indonesia, ideally in the Greater Jakarta area (Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Tangerang, Bekasi.) Occasional travel within Indonesia might also be necessary. Key Responsibilities • Lead Ember’s research on Indonesia’s coal mine methane (CMM) emissions to better understand the challenges and opportunities • Gather data that can be analysed and used to tell a story of the significance of methane in Indonesia’s coal mining sector • Use data and research to write op-eds and reports that grab attention with the right players • Collaborate with Ember’s existing team in Indonesia and build relationships with research institutes, think tanks and government organisations • Lead on developing a strategy for how to raise the priority of CMM and how to realise the opportunities in improving the monitoring and capture of CMM. • Align our CMM work with the wider energy transition in Indonesia • Brief government and NGO contacts on CMM opportunities and lead workshops/webinars and panel discussions to improve awareness • Use understanding of the policy landscape to identify opportunities and tipping points where we might shift the narrative and have an impact on CMM Requirements We are especially keen to encourage applications from people underrepresented in climate change analysis and campaigning. Climate change is a race issue, a class issue, and a gender issue. We welcome applicants with lived experiences of these issues. Must have • Ability to research and source coal mining emissions data and curate datasets • Minimum five (5) years working in relevant senior research, analyst or policy positions for a climate think tank, NGO, academia or private sector organisation working in Indonesia (background in the mining industry also welcomed); • An effective networker with an established network in Indonesia’s energy and coal space and contacts in relevant government organisations • Knowledge of the coal sector in Indonesia and where this fits with climate, energy and environmental politics and experience in developing strategies to influence policy • Able to work independently and effectively in both spoken and written English and Indonesian, such as writing articles and reports without supervision and attending meetings with Indonesian government officials. • Passionate about reducing global greenhouse gas emissions • Confident working remotely with a broad range of people, from different countries and timezones. Nice to have • Experience of working with anthropogenic methane emissions (coal, oil, gas, agriculture, biogas…) • Experience of developing policy or campaigning in the policy field • Experience liaising with key government ministries and agencies in Indonesia, such as Ministry of Environment and Forestry (KLHK), Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (Kemen ESDM), Ministry of National Development Planning (Bappenas), and/or National Energy Council (DEN) • Experience liaising with private sector, particularly coal companies • Communications/outreach experience to communicate complex ideas succinctly and to influence climate narratives • Fascination with data and data visualisation Benefits Salary: Competitive Contract: Full time (but only working 9 days every fortnight with no reduction in pay), permanent subject to a 3 month probationary period. Further benefits: We offer a competitive benefits package, including: • We operate a nine-day fortnight meaning our full-time staff are given every other Friday off work with no reduction in pay • 25 days holiday, plus UK bank holidays (unless local statutory minimums are higher) • For each year that you're part of the team at Ember you'll receive an additional day of holiday, up to a maximum of 5 additional days. • Generous paid maternity and paternity leave • Flexible working conditions, including the opportunity for part-time work and home working. • Access to a counselling service • Funding and allocated time for your training and development • Paid volunteer day • Two paid days off to enable low carbon travel • Season Ticket loan

job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Engineer Network and Wireless will be responsible for designing, implementing, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting the organizations business and process control networks and wireless infrastructure. This role will work closely with production teams and other engineers to identify and solve process control issues, and ensure that production processes are efficient, reliable and safe. This position will play a critical role in ensuring that the organizations business and process control networks are designed, implemented, and maintained to meet business needs, while ensuring the security, reliability, and performance of the network and make important decisions to achieve these goals. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Design and implement network infrastructure solutions that meet the companys business requirements. • Configure and maintain network hardware and software, including routers, switches, wireless access devices, network controllers, and virtual appliances. • Monitor network performance and troubleshoot network issues to ensure uptime and performance targets of 99.95% are meet. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement security policies and procedures to protect the network against unauthorized access, viruses, and other security threats. • Planning and executing network infrastructure upgrades, such as upgrading hardware, software and security protocols and ensure these upgrades are implemented in a timely and efficient manner. • Develop and maintain network documentation, including network diagrams, inventory lists and maintenance schedules. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of network related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. • Collaborate with production teams, management, and other engineers to identify process control problems, analyze data, and propose solutions. The key challenges in this position include: • Keeping up with Technology: Networking technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that you have the skills and knowledge necessary to provide effective support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Network Security: Ensuring network security is a critical task for network engineers. As hackers become more sophisticated, protecting networks against cyber-attacks is becoming more challenging. You will need to stay up to date with the latest security threats and implement measures to prevent them. • Troubleshooting: Network outages can be detrimental to the business operations and profitability. You must be able to diagnose and troubleshoot issues quickly and effectively to minimize downtime. • Communication Skills: Network engineers need to have excellent communication skills to collaborate with other IT professionals, stakeholders, and end users. You must be able to explain complex technical issues in non-technical terms to ensure that everyone understands the problem and proposed solution. • Managing Customer Expectations: Customers may have high expectations with the resources and capabilities of the team. Effective communication and managing expectations can help mitigate these challenges. • Hazardous Environment: Smelting operations can be dangerous, you must be aware of and follow strict safety protocols when visiting and working in these environments, using specialized protective gear to ensure safety. • High Pressure Environment: Mining and smelting operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field. • Certification, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) • 5+ Years of experience in network support. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong knowledge of business network infrastructure and design including telephone systems, digital trunk radio, network protocols, fiber optic / ethernet cabling standards and AC/DC power systems. • Strong knowledge of network protocols and technologies such as TCP/IP, routing protocols (BGP, OSPF), VLANS, VPNs and QoS. • Experience with network security technologies such as firewalls and intrusion detection systems. • Strong knowledge and understanding of process control systems such as Distributed Control Systems (DCS) Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) and other data acquisition systems. • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. • Ability to troubleshoot network issues and provide technical support. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in the metal processing industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. The key areas in which you have decision-making responsibility are: • Designing and implementing network architecture: Responsible for designing and implementing network architecture based on the companys requirements and industry best practices. Must analyze the companys network needs, assess the available hardware and software options, and make informed decisions to build an efficient and secure network infrastructure. • Selecting hardware and software components: Must choose the right hardware and software components for the network, based on factors such as performance, compatibility, scalability, security, and cost. Must evaluate and compare different options and make recommendations to management. • Troubleshooting network issues: When network issues arise, must diagnose the problem, and find a solution quickly. Must make decisions to ensure that the network is up and running as soon as possible and minimize downtime and data loss. • Planning and implementing network security: Must decide on the appropriate security measures to protect the network from cyber threats. Must evaluate risks, select security tools, configure firewalls and other security devices, and monitor the network activity for signs of intrusion. • Capacity planning: Must forecast the companys future network needs and make decisions about how to scale the network infrastructure to meet those needs. Must analyze traffic patterns, predict growth, and make recommendations for upgrades and expansions. Dimensions Financial • Repair or Replace: Making decisions as to if repairing or replacing a device would be the most cost-effective long term. • Cost Control: Will be responsible for controlling costs associated with network support, including identifying areas for cost savings. Non-Financial • Maintain: Manage the lifecycle of network infrastructure assets comprising hundreds of network routers, switches, wireless access points, telephones, digital trunk radio systems, fiber and ethernet cabling systems. • Customer Satisfaction: Meeting the needs of the organizations one thousand end users, spread across several geographic locations, including users working remotely and resolving technical issues in a timely and effective manner. Dateline: 27 may 2023

job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Engineer Systems Management will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, configuration, and reliable operations of servers, storage, backups, and disaster recovery environment, to ensure the efficient and uninterrupted operation of the compute environment, as well as to maintain the security and integrity of the data stored within.This position will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operating of the organizations server infrastructure, which is essential for maintaining productivity and keeping the business running smoothly. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Ensure the reliable and secure operations of the data center, and to ensure that it meets the needs of the business. • Installation, maintenance and repair of data center hardware and software. • Backing up and restoring data to prevent loss in the case of system failure. • Managing user accounts, permissions, and access rights. • Patching, ensuring the environment is continuously updated and patched to remediate all known vulnerabilities and reducing the risk of zero-day attacks. • Executing server and storage infrastructure upgrades, such as upgrading hardware, software and ensuring these upgrades are implemented in a timely and efficient manner. • Managing data center security, ensuring that the data center is secure from unauthorized access or cyber-attacks. • Monitoring server and storage performance as well as event logs to identify any issues or potential problems and take steps to address them before they impact the business. • Ensuring compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) related to data retention, security, and privacy. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of system related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. • Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure that all systems are integrated and working together seamlessly. • Participate in the development and implementation of IT projects related to server and storage infrastructure. The key challenges in this position include: • Data Security: The metals industry relies heavily on data to make informed decisions. As a systems engineer, you will need to ensure that the servers and storage are secure from unauthorized access and that sensitive data is protected from cyber threats. • Equipment Maintenance: Server and storage systems requires frequent maintenance and repairs. As a systems engineer, you will need to coordinate with maintenance teams to ensure that equipment downtime is minimized, and server connectivity is restored as quickly as possible. • Capacity Planning: As the number of users and data grows, it is important to anticipate and plan for future capacity needs. This requires careful monitoring of system performance and usage trends to ensure that there is enough capacity to handle future growth. • Meeting Service Level Agreements: Ensuring that the systems you manage meet the service level agreements set by the organization. This requires effective communication with other departments and stakeholders to ensure that service expectations are met. • Keeping up with Technological Advancements: Data center technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that you are providing the best possible support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Resolving Complex and Technical Issues: This role will be responsible for handling complex technical issues that the team may not be able to resolve on their own. This requires a strong technical background and the ability to troubleshoot and solve problems quickly. • Hazardous Environment: Smelting operations can be dangerous, you must be aware of and follow strict safety protocols when visiting and working in these environments, using specialized protective gear to ensure safety. • High Pressure Environment: Mining and smelting operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. • Ensuring Compliance with Regulations: There are numerous government regulations that govern the use and management of data. You need to understand and follow the regulations, including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) and implementing appropriate security measures to protect the systems and sensitive data. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field. • Certification, Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA) • Certification, VMware Certified Professional (VCP) • Certification, Nutanix Certified Professional (NCP) • 5+ Years of experience in systems administration management. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong technical skills in areas such as server and network administration, operating systems, databases, Active Directory, virtualization, and security. • Automation, experience with scripting and automation tools to streamline repetitive tasks and increase efficiency. • Knowledge and understanding of process control and data acquisition systems. • Knowledge of regulations that govern data retention and privacy including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. • Excellent communication and leadership skills. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Flexibility to work outside regular business house when necessary. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in the metal processing industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. The key areas in which you have decision-making responsibility are: • A systems engineer key decision-making responsibilities involve ensuring the data center infrastructure is secure, efficient, and meets the business needs. • Planning and Designing: A systems engineer is responsible for designing, planning a, and maintaining the data centers infrastructure. job_description: Title: Technical Expert, Geotechnical Analysis Support Systems Requisition ID: 89728 Location: Papua, ID, 99967 Category: Engineering Services Description: PTFI’s Grasberg operations consist of a number of world-class mines that are targeted to produce 240,000 tons of copper ore per day. job_title: Smelter Operation Readiness - Superintendent Systems Management
job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Superintendent Systems Management will be responsible for managing a team of systems administrators overseeing the installation, maintenance, configuration, and reliable operation of servers, storage, backups, and disaster recovery environment, to ensure the efficient and uninterrupted operation of the compute environment, as well as to maintain the security and integrity of the data stored within. This position will oversee the day-to-day operations of the team, ensuring that the team is able to maintain and troubleshoot the business and process control compute environments, monitor the performance, and respond to technical issues in a timely and effective manner. This supervisory position is to ensure that the server infrastructure is secure, stable, operates effectively and efficiently, with minimal downtime and disruptions, so that the organization can rely on it to process, store and manage its critical data. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Leading and supervising system administrators, overseeing the day-to-day operations of the data center, providing guidance and technical support to ensure that they are meeting their responsibilities effectively. • Monitoring server and storage performance as well as event logs to identify any issues or potential problems and take steps to address them before they impact the organization. • Managing the installation, maintenance and repair of data center hardware and software. • Implementing procedures for backup and disaster recovery to ensure the data centers operations can be restored in the event of a system failure or other catastrophic issue. • Manage user accounts, permissions, and access rights. • Ensuring compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) related to data retention, security, and privacy. • Patching, ensuring the Environment is continuously updated and patched to remediate all known vulnerabilities and reducing the risk of zero-day attacks. • Planning and implementing server and storage infrastructure upgrades, such as upgrading hardware, software and ensuring these upgrades are implemented in a timely and efficient manner. • Managing data center security, ensuring that the data center is secure from unauthorized access or cyber-attacks. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of system related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. • Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure that all systems are integrated and working together seamlessly. • Participate in the development and implementation of IT projects related to server and storage infrastructure. • Recruiting, training and mentoring new and existing system administrators and evaluating the performance of system administrators. • Budgeting and resource management, of the server administration team and ensure that resources are used effectively to support the organizations goals and objectives. The key challenges in this position include: • Managing a Team: One of the biggest challenges will be managing a team of system administrators, including subordinates from various ethnicities, religions, and cultures, to maximize their full potential, this includes hiring, training, coaching and performance management. This can be challenging, especially when dealing with conflicts and differing highly technical opinions. • Data Security: The metals industry relies heavily on data to make informed decisions. As a systems administrator supervisor, you will need to ensure that the servers and storage are secure from unauthorized access and that sensitive data is protected from cyber threats. • Equipment Maintenance: Server and storage systems requires frequent maintenance and repairs. As a systems administrator supervisor, you will need to coordinate with maintenance teams to ensure that equipment downtime is minimized, and server connectivity is restored as quickly as possible. • Meeting Service Level Agreements: Responsible for ensuring that your team meets the service level agreements set by the organization. This requires effective communication with other departments and stakeholders to ensure that service expectations are met. • Keeping up with Technological Advancements: Data center technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that the team is providing the best possible support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Prioritizing Tasks: This supervisory position will need to prioritize tasks and delegate responsibilities to ensure that all issues are addressed in a timely and efficient manner. You will on occasion need to prioritize urgent issues and handle conflicting demands from different stakeholders. • Resolving Complex and Technical Issues: This role will be responsible for handling complex technical issues that the team may not be able to resolve on their own. This requires a strong technical background and the ability to troubleshoot and solve problems quickly. • Managing Customer Expectations: Customers may have high expectations with the resources and capabilities of the team. Effective communication and managing expectations can help mitigate these challenges. • Hazardous Environment: Smelting operations can be dangerous, the systems supervisor must be aware of and follow strict safety protocols when visiting and working in these environments, using specialized protective gear to ensure safety. • High Pressure Environment: Mining and smelting operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, and as a supervisor, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. • Ensuring Compliance with Regulations: There are numerous government regulations that govern the use and management of data. As a supervisor, you need to ensure that your team is following the regulations, including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) and implementing appropriate security measures to protect the systems and sensitive data. • Staff Retention: In remote locations, attracting and retaining skilled staff can be a challenge. This supervisory position must create an environment that fosters a positive workplace culture and provides opportunities for professional growth and development to retain staff. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field. • Certification, Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA) • Certification, VMware Certified Professional (VCP) • Certification, Nutanix Certified Professional (NCP) • 5+ Years of experience in systems administration management and at least 2 years in a supervisory role. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong technical skills in areas such as server and network administration, operating systems, databases, Active Directory, virtualization and security. • Automation, experience with scripting and automation tools to streamline repetitive tasks and increase efficiency. • Knowledge and understanding of process control and data acquisition systems. • Experience managing and maintaining a large business and or process control data center. • Knowledge of regulations that govern data retention and privacy including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. • Excellent communication and leadership skills. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in the metal processing industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. The key areas in which you have decision-making responsibility are: • Managing Staff: Making decision regarding staffing, training and performance management and the allocation of resource and delegation of tasks. • Resource Allocation: Required to make decisions about the allocation of resources, including personnel, equipment, and budget, for system maintenance, support, and expansion. • Performance Optimization: Monitoring system performance, identifying areas of weakness, and implementing strategies to optimize server performance. • Compute and Storage Capacity Planning and Management: Making decisions related to compute, memory and storage capacity, management, and data archiving. • Incident Management: Prioritizing incidents based on severity and impact, assigning incidents to support staff, and ensuring that incidents are resolved within agreed-upon service level agreements. • Procurement: Making decision regarding the procurement of hardware, software, and other equipment necessary for the smooth functioning of the data center. • Vendor Management: Make decisions about the selection and management of external vendors that provide technical support services. This includes negotiating contracts, managing vendor relationships, and ensuring that vendors meet service level agreements. • Technology Upgrades: Make decisions about when and how to upgrade hardware and software. This includes assessing the impact of upgrades on end-users and control systems, developing upgrade plans, and coordinating the implementation of upgrades with other teams within the organization. • Evaluating New Technologies: Evaluate new technologies and tools that can improve the support services provided by the team. This includes evaluating new software applications, hardware and other technologies that can enhance the user experience. • Continuous Improvement: Continually evaluate the effectiveness of support service and make decision to improve processes, procedures, and training programs to enhance the quality of support provided. • Budgeting: Manage the budget allocated for the data center, ensuring that it is being used efficiently and effectively. This includes monitoring expenses and forecasting future needs to ensure that the team has the resources it needs to deliver high quality support services. Dimensions Financial • Budgeting: Will be responsible for developing and managing an annual operating budget of approximately US$ 1 MM. Managing the budget for the team, including allocating resources for hardware, software, and other technical needs. • Repair or Replace: Making decisions as to if repairing or replacing a device would be the most cost-effective long term. • Cost Control: Will be responsible for controlling costs associated with the data center, including identifying areas for cost savings, and negotiating vendor support contracts. • ROI Analysis: Required to perform return of investment (ROI) analysis to determine the financial impact or support initiatives or projects as well as make decisions on repair vs. replace. Non-Financial • Maintain: The supervisor must manage the lifecycle of data center hardware and software assets as well as manage data retention. • Leadership: The supervisor is responsible for leading the team and ensuring that they are working effectively and efficiently. This includes setting expectations, providing guidance, and motivating team members. • Customer Satisfaction: The supervisor must ensure that their team is meeting the needs of the organizations one thousand end users, spread across several geographic locations, including users working remotely and resolving technical issues in a timely and effective manner. • Performance Management: The supervisor will be responsible for evaluating the performance of their direct and indirect reports, providing feedback, and identifying areas for improvement. • Process Improvement: The supervisor should be able to identify opportunities for process improvement and develop strategies for implementing changes that will increase efficiency and effectiveness. Dateline: 27 May 2023

job_description: Title: Technical Advisor, Risk Assurance and Compliance Requisition ID: 114147 Location: Papua, ID, 99967 Category: Health & Safety Description: Direct, oversee and evaluate the development and implementation of Underground Division’s Safety, Health, and Environment (SHE) programs, policies, and procedures. Responsibilities are to provide oversight in the setup of new health and safety systems that improve performance, change the safety culture and improve the training and understanding of the work force to ensure safety is at the forefront of all activities.
